summary.p: This module enables SSL encryption for a specified port. It takes advantage of the SSL encryption functionality that is built into the NetWare operating system.

directivesynopsis.name: SecureListen
directivesynopsis.description: Enables SSL encryption for the specified port

usage.p: Specifies the port and the eDirectory based certificate name that will be used to enable SSL encryption. An optional third parameter also enables mutual authentication.

Specifies a list of client certificate files (DER format) that are used when creating a proxied SSL connection. Each client certificate used by a server must be listed separately in its own .der file.

directivesynopsis.name: NWSSLUpgradeable
directivesynopsis.description: Allows a connection to be upgraded to an SSL connection upon request

usage.p: Allow a connection that was created on the specified address and/or port to be upgraded to an SSL connection upon request from the client. The address and/or port must have already be defined previously with a Listen directive.
